alert.note: Alert for Coke; Irion; Runnels; Sterling; Tom Green (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS San Angelo (Central Texas San Angelo)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 01 at 9:31PM CDT by NWS San Angelo
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Coke, southeastern Sterling, northeastern Tom Green, southwestern Runnels and eastern Irion Counties through 1030 PM CDT... At 930 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Sanco to 8 miles southwest of E.V. Spence Reservoir Near Paint Creek Recreation Area to 17 miles southwest of Broome. Movement was southeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... San Angelo, Robert Lee, Mertzon, Maverick, Bronte, Miles, E.V. Spence Reservoir Near Paint Creek Recreation Area, Grape Creek, Goodfellow Air Force Base, Knickerbocker, Arden, Lake Nasworthy, Tankersley, Harriet, Rowena, Orient, San Angelo State Park, Twin Buttes Reservoir, Water Valley and Sherwood. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM CDT for west central Texas.

area.areaDesc: Coke; Irion; Runnels; Sterling; Tom Green
